Problem:
Consider a system governed by the partial differential equation \\( \\frac{\\partial u}{\\partial t} = Lu \\), where L is a linear differential operator. We study the effect of the Fourier transform \\( \\mathcal{F}(u) = \\int_{-\\infty}^\\infty e^{-ixt}u(t)dt \\) on the function u over time t.

If the initial function \\( u_0 \\) is transformed via \\( \\mathcal{F}(u) \\) at t = 0 and then evolved under \\( \\frac{\\partial u}{\\partial t} = Lu \\) without any further modification, will the function u(t) at t = T be equivalent to the direct evolution of \\( u_0 \\) under \\( \\frac{\\partial u}{\\partial t} = Lu \\) to t = T?
Explanation: The Fourier transform alters the initial conditions by transforming the function into the frequency domain, thereby changing the characteristics and subsequent evolution of the system. The solution path of \\( u(t) \\) will differ as a result of these initial modifications.
